*Because it is politically incorrect for Tibetans in China to refer to the non-Tibetan parts
of thePeople's Republic of China as“China,”since thatimplies to some thatTibet and
China are separate entities,the Chinese term neidi, meaning “inner”or “inland”(tib.
nangsa), is normally used. We will translate the term as “inland China."
